docs.snippet: Passengers scheduled to depart today for the West Indies, Venezuela and Colombia on the Grace liner Santa Rosa include Miss Natalie Henry, Mr. and Mrs. William Hall, Carlos Salazar, Mr. and Mrs. Richard J. Dunn, Miss Cecilia Quijano, Dr. and Mrs....
docs.lead_paragraph: Passengers scheduled to depart today for the West Indies, Venezuela and Colombia on the Grace liner Santa Rosa include Miss Natalie Henry, Mr. and Mrs. William Hall, Carlos Salazar, Mr. and Mrs. Richard J. Dunn, Miss Cecilia Quijano, Dr. and Mrs. Edward L. Curran, Mrs. Marion F. Eberly, Miss Esther R. Barnes, Miss Kathryn Barnes, Miss Esther Carlson, Mr. and Mrs. John B. Hyde and Dr. and Mrs. Glenn I. Jones.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 2 -- The United States welcomes and wholeheartedly supports the proposal made by Uruguay on June 21 for the American republics to adopt a policy of not treating as a belligerent any American country, which, in defense of its own...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 2 -- The United States welcomes and wholeheartedly supports the proposal made by Uruguay on June 21 for the American republics to adopt a policy of not treating as a belligerent any American country, which, in defense of its own rights, should find itself in a state of war with nations of other continents.

docs.snippet: Anti-fascist spokesmen representing Italy, Norway, France, China, Latin America and the United States broadcast messages of confidence and warnings against appeasement policies to both, the free and suppressed peoples of three continents at a meeting...
docs.lead_paragraph: Anti-fascist spokesmen representing Italy, Norway, France, China, Latin America and the United States broadcast messages of confidence and warnings against appeasement policies to both, the free and suppressed peoples of three continents at a meeting yesterday afternoon of the newly organized International Free World Association.

docs.snippet: WASHINGTON, July 4 -- Douglas Fairbanks Jr., special envoy for President Roosevelt on a recent South American tour, assured radio listeners in this country tonight that the democratic ideal was strong in the countries he visited, but insisted that...
docs.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, July 4 -- Douglas Fairbanks Jr., special envoy for President Roosevelt on a recent South American tour, assured radio listeners in this country tonight that the democratic ideal was strong in the countries he visited, but insisted that those who minimize the danger of Nazi invasion of the southern continent are living in a "false paradise."
